div1.head: Letter from William L. Lazear to Charlotte C. Lazear, July 31, 1871
div1.p:
I reached home at
precisely forty minutes after
ten this morning -- a little
tired from so early a ride
-- but much refreshed for
business

Jim said father was in
this morning and expected
all well --

Kate expects to leave the
Summit on tuesday evening
and Jim thinks that she
and father may go to Jordan
Spring- last of the week.

--I trust, dear Charles that
you may improve in health
- and with this hope I am
content to be separated from
you for a time, -- and can
even ask you to continue your
sojourn at Jordan so long as
you enjoy yourself and feel
that you are benefited--

--I will report tomorrow
the appearance of our loved ones
at hope -- May God bless
you and them and
div1.closer:
Your devoted Husband I neglected to leave the stamps
with you -- and now enclose
them -- See that you use them.
